turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Flat iron steak.
turn.2: Flat iron steak  Flat iron steak (US), butlers' steak (UK), or oyster blade steak (Australia and New Zealand) is a cut of steak cut with the grain from the shoulder of the animal.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: This produces a flavorful cut that is a bit tough because it contains a gristly fascia membrane unless removed.
turn.6: Some restaurants offer it on their menu, often at lower price than the more popular rib-eye and strip steaks of the same grade.
turn.7: What other cuts of steak are similar?
turn.8: This is used, in some places, as a means of selling a less expensive cut from the same animal, for example Kobe beef.
turn.9: Where does the steak come from?
turn.10: This cut of steak is from the shoulder of a beef animal.
turn.11: Where is the steak on the cow?
turn.12: It is located adjacent to the heart of the shoulder clod, under the seven or paddle bone (shoulder blade or scapula).
